China is flexing its muscles these days.

Among those actions: last year's takeover of a disputed shoal in the South China Sea that had been under Philippine control.
It started when Philippine authorities tried to arrest Chinese they accused of illegally fishing inside the shoal - really a shallow, triangle-shaped reef with a small opening at one end.
China sent marine surveillance ships to block the Philippine boats.
So one of the measures that they've put in place was to string a line across the mouth of that entrance, because if any vessel tries to cross that line it will get entangled in the propellers.
So that effectively also blockaded the reef itself.
